meanings.definition: A person who whips or beats something.
meanings.sent1: The whippers at the bakery were busy making delicious cakes.
meanings.sent2: I need to buy a new set of whippers for my kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The whippers in the kitchen were having a dance-off with the spatulas.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like whippers, cutting through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The whippers in the orchestra added a dramatic flair to the music.

meanings.definition: A device used for whipping or mixing ingredients.
meanings.sent1: The electric whippers made baking a breeze.
meanings.sent2: She used the whippers to make fluffy whipped cream.
meanings.sent3: The whippers in the drawer were having a party with the measuring cups.
meanings.sent4: The wind was a fierce whipper, stirring up the leaves in the yard.
meanings.sent5: The whippers in the kitchen were essential for making the perfect meringue.

meanings.definition: To move quickly or suddenly in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The cat would suddenly whippers across the room when chasing a toy.
meanings.sent2: I saw him whippers past me on his skateboard.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to whippers up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to whippers by as we enjoyed our day at the park.
meanings.sent5: The leaves whippers around in the wind, creating a whirlwind of colors.
